intro: Enterosora forsythiana, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are clustered in racemes, adding ornamental value to gardens. Enterosora forsythiana is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in local herbal remedies.
